org.sd.xml.record
Class Settings

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.record.Settings

public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object

Class to parse xml settings files using the Record abstraction.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

Settings

public Settings(java.util.Properties properties,
                java.io.File settingsFile)
Load with the given properties and settings file.

Note that the settings will be reloaded if the settings file has been modified.

Settings

public Settings(java.util.Properties properties,
                Record topRecord)
Construct with the given properties and top record.

Method Detail

getTopRecord

public Record getTopRecord()
Get the top record containing all settings.

If this instance was constructed using a settings file and that file has been modified, the settings will be reloaded.

hasNewSettings

public boolean hasNewSettings()
Determine whether new settings may be available.

getSettingsRecord

public Record getSettingsRecord(java.lang.String name)
Convenience method to get the (first) named settings record.

Note that a settings record is one of the root's children.

If this instance was constructed using a settings file and that file has been modified, the settings will be reloaded.

getAllSettingRecords

public java.util.List<Record> getAllSettingRecords(java.lang.String name)
Convenience method to get the all named settings records.

Note each settings record is one of the root's children.

If this instance was constructed using a settings file and that file has been modified, the settings will be reloaded.

getAllSettingRecords

public java.util.List<Record> getAllSettingRecords(java.lang.String name,
                                                   Record record)
Convenience method to get the all named settings records under the given record.

getSettingsValue

public java.lang.String getSettingsValue(Record settingsRecord,
                                         java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get the setting record's first value for the given attribute.

If the value doesn't exist, then null will be returned. If the value exists with text, then the text will be returned. If the value exists with no text, but has a property attribute, then the named property will be retrieved from this instance's properties. If there is no 'property' attribute, then the property matching "attribute" will be retrieved from this instance's properties.

getSettingsValue

public java.lang.String getSettingsValue(Record settingsRecord,
                                         java.lang.String attribute,
                                         java.lang.String defaultValue)
Convenience method to get the setting record's first value for the given attribute.

If the value doesn't exist, then null will be returned. If the value exists with text, then the text will be returned. If the value exists with no text, but has a property attribute, then the named property will be retrieved from this instance's properties. If there is no 'property' attribute, then the property matching "attribute" will be retrieved from this instance's properties.

getSettingsValue

public java.lang.String getSettingsValue(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get the first settings record and its first value for the given attribute.

getSettingsValue

public java.lang.String getSettingsValue(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String attribute,
                                         java.lang.String defaultValue)
Convenience method to get the first settings record and its first value for the given attribute.

getSettingsValues

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSettingsValues(Record settingsRecord,
                                                         java.lang.String attribute)
Get all values for the given attribute from the given settings record.

getSettingsValues

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSettingsValues(java.lang.String name,
                                                         java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get the first settings record and all of its values for the given attribute.
